headline: How major US stock indexes fared Monday, 8/4/2025
summary: The S&P 500 rose 1.5% Monday, following its worst day since May. The Dow Jones Industrial Average jumped 1.3%, and the Nasdaq composite climbed 2%.  Gains for Tyson Foods and other companies following better-than-expected profit reports helped offset a drop for Berkshire Hathaway.  The Nasdaq composite rose 403.45 points, or 2%, to 21,053.58.

content.title: How major US stock indexes fared Monday, 8/4/2025
content.summary: The S&P 500 rose 1.5% Monday, following its worst day since May. The Dow Jones Industrial Average jumped 1.3%, and the Nasdaq composite climbed 2%.  Gains for Tyson Foods and other companies following better-than-expected profit reports helped offset a drop for Berkshire Hathaway.  The Nasdaq composite rose 403.45 points, or 2%, to 21,053.58.

headline: Tyson Foods (TSN) Stock Is Up, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of meat company Tyson Foods (NYSE:TSN) jumped 4.7% in the afternoon session after the company reported strong fiscal third-quarter results that surpassed analyst expectations. The meat processing giant posted revenue of approximately $13.9 billion, a 4% increase from the same period last year, which topped market forecasts. The company's adjusted earnings per share landed at $0.91, also beating consensus estimates and improving from the prior year. Strong consumer demand for its chicken a

headline: Tyson Foods, Spotify, American Eagle: Trending Tickers

Spotify (SPOT) stock is climbing after the company announced price hikes across global markets. American Eagle Outfitters (AEO) stock is surging after President Trump publicly backed its controversial Sydney Sweeney jeans ad, fueling buzz across Wall Street and Main Street. headline: Tyson Foods Raises Outlook As CEO Highlights Resilient Protein Portfolio
summary: Tyson Foods Inc.’s (NYSE: TSN) stock surged on Monday after it reported better-than-expected third‑quarter results. Adjusted earnings of 91 cents per share beat the average analyst estimate of 88 cents. Revenue grew 4% year-over-year to $13.88 billion, topping the $13.54 billion estimate. Total sales volume declined 0.1% in the quarter, while average selling prices rose 3.7%, resulting in an overall 4% gain. GAAP earnings dropped to 17 cents per share from 54 cents a year earlier, driven by a $3

headline: Tyson Foods (NYSE:TSN) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q2
summary: Meat company Tyson Foods (NYSE:TSN) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 3.6% year on year to $13.88 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.91 per share was 16.2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Tyson Foods boosts revenue forecast as chicken sales rise
summary: (Reuters) -Tyson Foods raised its annual revenue forecast and reported better-than-expected quarterly earnings on Monday as consumers' increased appetite for chicken helped offset steep losses in its beef business.  The herd dwindled to its smallest size on record this summer after a years-long drought dried up pastures used for grazing, forcing meat companies like Tyson to pay more to buy cattle to slaughter.  However, Tyson benefited in the quarter that ended on June 28 from increased sales volumes and prices for its chicken.

content.title: Tyson Foods boosts revenue forecast as chicken sales rise
content.summary: (Reuters) -Tyson Foods raised its annual revenue forecast and reported better-than-expected quarterly earnings on Monday as consumers' increased appetite for chicken helped offset steep losses in its beef business.  The herd dwindled to its smallest size on record this summer after a years-long drought dried up pastures used for grazing, forcing meat companies like Tyson to pay more to buy cattle to slaughter.  However, Tyson benefited in the quarter that ended on June 28 from increased sales volumes and prices for its chicken.

headline: McDonald’s Earnings, New Tariff Deadline, PMIs: What to Watch This Week
summary: Earnings season marches on, with results from Walt Disney and McDonald’s among this week's highlights, along with President Trump's new tariff-hike deadline for many countries. Trump also said he would name replacements this week for Federal Reserve governor Adriana Kugler and Bureau of Labor Statistics chief Erika McEntarfer.

content.title: McDonald’s Earnings, New Tariff Deadline, PMIs: What to Watch This Week
content.summary: Earnings season marches on, with results from Walt Disney and McDonald’s among this week's highlights, along with President Trump's new tariff-hike deadline for many countries. Trump also said he would name replacements this week for Federal Reserve governor Adriana Kugler and Bureau of Labor Statistics chief Erika McEntarfer.

headline: Dow leaps 585 points as US stocks win back most of Friday's wipeout
summary: U.S. stocks rallied on Monday and won back most of their sharp loss from last week, when worries about how President Donald Trump’s tariffs  may be punishing the economy  sent a shudder through Wall Street.  Idexx Laboratories helped lead the way and soared 27.5% after the seller of veterinary instruments and other health care products reported a stronger profit for the spring than analysts expected.  The pressure is on U.S. companies to deliver bigger profits after their stock prices shot to record after record recently.

content.title: Dow leaps 585 points as US stocks win back most of Friday's wipeout
content.summary: U.S. stocks rallied on Monday and won back most of their sharp loss from last week, when worries about how President Donald Trump’s tariffs  may be punishing the economy  sent a shudder through Wall Street.  Idexx Laboratories helped lead the way and soared 27.5% after the seller of veterinary instruments and other health care products reported a stronger profit for the spring than analysts expected.  The pressure is on U.S. companies to deliver bigger profits after their stock prices shot to record after record recently.
